00069     /// @internal
00070     /// @namespace phys::internal
00071     /// @brief This namespace is used for internal helper classes, and in general it should be ignored by game developers
00072     /// @details This whole internal namespace is a home for dirty hacks and internal dependant code. This is where code goes that must implement classes or functions for the various subsytems the Physgame engine draws on.
00073     namespace internal
00074     {
00075         /// @internal
00076         /// @brief SDL uses this to filter events it presents to applications
00077         /// @details This is used used to filter out SQL_quit messages, and generate appropriate messages for the game developer to use.
00078         /// This will always drop quit events, and store that information for later use.
00079         /// @param event This is the event SDL expects use to filters, To get real data from this we setup it up so that if the event is a null pointer the function will return data about quit messages
00080         /// @param userdata Nothing, a dummy argument that could be used by SDL
00081         /// @warning Do not use this. It can only cause problems. This is for SDL, the user input subsystem, to filter certain events.
00082         /// @return This will always return either 0 or 1 to SDL. 0 if it should drop the event, which it does to all SDL_quit events, 1 if the event should be allowed, which it does to all events which are not SDL_quit events. If a null pointer was passed, then this will return 4 if it dropped an SDL_Quit, and 2 if it has not droppped an SDL_quit.
00083         //int PhysSDLFilter(void *userdata, const SDL_Event *event,  );
00084         //If this is passed an event that points to 0 it will function as a method to tell us if an SDL_QUIT message has been thrown
00085         //this will return 2 if it has not seen an SDL_quit, and a 4 if it has
00086         int PhysSDLFilter(void *userdata, SDL_Event *event )
00087         {
00088             //We need to protect this thing with a Mutex, SDL 1.3 says this filter could run in different thread.
00089             static bool DroppedQuit=false;
00090 
00091             if(event!=0)                //if this is a real event
00092             {
00093                 if ( event->type == SDL_QUIT )
00094                 {
00095                     DroppedQuit=true;   //Drop all quit events, and track that we dropped them
00096                     return 0;
00097                 }
00098                 return 1;
00099             }else{
00100                 if(DroppedQuit)         //4 if we need to make a quit event
00101                 {
00102                     DroppedQuit=false;  //Reset this so we don't add more in the future by accident
00103                     return 4;
00104                 }
00105                 return 2;
00106             }
00107         }
00108 
00109         /// @internal
00110         /// @brief Used to increase encapsulation, just a bit.
00111         struct EventManagerInternalData
00112         {
00113             /// @internal
00114             /// @brief The Queue that all the events get stored in
00115             std::list<EventBase*> EventQ;
00116 
00117             /// @internal
00118             /// @brief The kinds of data that can be stored in Manual Check
00119             enum PollingType{
00120                 Polling     =1,
00121                 Keypress    =2
00122 
00123                 PollingKeyPress = Polling|Keypress;
00124             };
00125 
00126             /// @internal
00127             /// @brief A unified polling and event repeater
00128             /// the Inputcode is the kind of event to check for each frame. The PollingType is used to control what can turn on and off the pollingcheck check.
00129             std::map<MetaCode::InputCode, PollingType> ManualCheck;
00130 
00131             /// @internal
00132             typedef std::map<MetaCode::InputCode, PollingType>::iterator ManualCheckIterator;
00133 
00134             /// @internal
00135             /// @brief Adds one type of polling check
00136             /// @param OneCode The code that will be check for each frame, under the new condition
00137             /// @param _PollingCheck This is inserted into a new polling check or it is bitwise or'ed into an existing one, and this will trigger other parts of the code to insert event later on
00138             void AddInputCodeToManualCheck(MetaCode::InputCode OneCode, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00139             {
00140                 ManualCheckIterator Which = ManualCheck.find(OneCode);
00141                 if(ManualCheck.end() == Which )
00142                 {
00143                     ManualCheck[OneCode] = _PollingCheck;
00144                 }else{
00145                     Which->second = (PollingType)(Which->second | _PollingCheck); //An Item can be multiple kinds of polling checks
00146                 }
00147             }
00148 
00149             /// @internal
00150             /// @brief Adds one type of polling check where the data is only available as Ints
00151             /// @param OneCode The code that will be check for each frame, under the new condition
00152             /// @param _PollingCheck This is inserted into a new polling check or it is bitwise or'ed into an existing one, and this will trigger other parts of the code to insert event later on
00153             void AddInputCodeToManualCheck(int OneCode, int _PollingCheck)
00154             {
00155                 this->AddInputCodeToManualCheck(
00156                         static_cast<phys::MetaCode::InputCode>(OneCode),
00157                         static_cast<phys::internal::EventManagerInternalData::PollingType>(_PollingCheck)
00158                 );
00159             }
00160 
00161             /// @internal
00162             /// @brief Used to insert Codes into the list of items to be manually checked
00163             /// @param Transport A vector of every Meta that may need to be added to the list
00164             /// @param _PollingCheck This is inserted into a new polling check or it is bitwise or'ed into an existing one, and this will trigger other parts of the code to insert event later on
00165             void AddMetaCodesToManualCheck(vector<MetaCode> Transport, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00166             {
00167                 for ( vector<MetaCode>::iterator Iter=Transport.begin(); Iter!=Transport.end(); ++Iter)
00168                 {
00169                     MetaCode::InputCode temp = Iter->GetCode();
00170                     AddInputCodeToManualCheck(Iter->GetCode(), _PollingCheck);
00171                 }
00172             }
00173 
00174             /// @internal
00175             /// @brief Removes one type of polling check
00176             /// @param OneCode The code that will no longer be checked each frame, under the given condition
00177             /// @param _PollingCheck If this matches via bitwise or with the kind of polling check check stored for the existing InputCode then the it will be removed.
00178             void RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(const MetaCode::InputCode& OneCode, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00179             {
00180                 ManualCheckIterator Which = ManualCheck.find(OneCode);
00181                 if( ManualCheck.end() != Which )
00182                 {
00183                     if(Which->second == _PollingCheck)
00184                         { ManualCheck.erase(Which); }                           // if they are are equal then this
00185                     else
00186                         { Which->second = (PollingType)(Which->second & (~_PollingCheck)); }
00187                 }
00188             }
00189 
00190             /// @internal
00191             /// @brief Remove Items form the internal manual check list
00192             /// @param Transport A vector of every MetaCode that may need to be removed to the list
00193             /// @param _PollingCheck If this matches via bitwise or with the kind of polling check check stored for the existing InputCode then the it will be removed.
00194             void RemoveMetaCodesToManualCheck(vector<MetaCode> Transport, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00195             {
00196                 for ( vector<MetaCode>::iterator Iter=Transport.begin(); Iter!=Transport.end(); ++Iter)
00197                     { RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(Iter->GetCode(), _PollingCheck); }
00198             }
00199 
00200             /// @internal
00201             /// @brief This will identify the main Joystick
00202             SDL_Joystick *Joy0;
00203 
00204             /// @internal
00205             /// @brief Constructor, it only inits pointers to 0
00206             EventManagerInternalData()
00207             {
00208                 Joy0=0;
00209             }
00210 
00211         };
00212 
00213     } // /internal
00214 
00215     /// @todo TODO: Make the EventManager completely thread safe. IF this is completely thread safe, we can spawn numerous individual thread each accessing this and
00216     /// and the performance gain would almost scale directly with cpu core count increases. Look at boost scoped_lock
00217     EventManager::EventManager()
00218     {
00219         this->Priority=-40;
00220         this->_Data = new internal::EventManagerInternalData;
00221         SDL_InitSubSystem(SDL_INIT_JOYSTICK);
00222         this->DetectJoysticks();
00223 
00224         //Remove GameWorld Pointer From everything
00225         this->GameWorld = World::GetWorldPointer();
00226     }
00227 
00228     EventManager::~EventManager()
00229     {
00230         if(SDL_JoystickOpened(0))
00231             { SDL_JoystickClose(this->_Data->Joy0); }
00232 
00233         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); Iter++)
00234             { delete *Iter; }
00235         delete _Data;
00236     }
00237 
00238     void EventManager::DetectJoysticks()
00239     {
00240         if( SDL_NumJoysticks()>0 )
00241             { this->_Data->Joy0=SDL_JoystickOpen(0); }
00242     }
00243 
00244     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00245     //These functions will give you the next event or help you manage the events
00246     ///////////////////////////////////////
00247     size_t EventManager::GetRemainingEventCount()
00248         { return _Data->EventQ.size(); }
00249 
00250     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextEvent()
00251     {
00252         if(_Data->EventQ.empty())
00253             { return 0; }
00254         EventBase* results = _Data->EventQ.front();
00255         return results;
00256     }
00257 
00258     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextEvent()
00259     {
00260         if(_Data->EventQ.empty())
00261             { return 0; }
00262         EventBase* results = _Data->EventQ.front();
00263         _Data->EventQ.pop_front();
00264         return results;
00265     }
00266 
00267     void EventManager::RemoveNextEvent()
00268         { _Data->EventQ.pop_front(); }
00269 
00270     void EventManager::AddEvent(EventBase* EventToAdd)
00271         { _Data->EventQ.push_back(EventToAdd); }
00272 
00273     void EventManager::UpdateEvents()
00274     {
00275         UpdateQuitEvents(); //quit events skips the preprocessing step and goes straight into the the main Queue, becuase of how we need to get them from sdl
00276 
00277         RawEvent FromSDLRaw;                                    //used to hold data as we go through loop
00278         EventUserInput* FromSDLEvent = new EventUserInput();    //Used to build up all of our userinput data into one event
00279 
00280         /* Here is a list of SDL event which aren't coded yet.
00281         //event types
00282             SDL_FIRSTEVENT                              unused (do not remove)          Application events
00283             SDL_QUIT                            user-requested quit             Window events
00284             SDL_WINDOWEVENT                             window state change
00285          SDL_SYSWMEVENT                         system specific event           Keyboard events
00286             SDL_KEYDOWN                         key pressed
00287             SDL_KEYUP                           key released
00288         SDL_TEXTEDITING                         keyboard text editing (composition)
00289         SDL_TEXTINPUT                           keyboard text input             Mouse events
00290             SDL_MOUSEMOTION                             mouse moved
00291             SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN                         mouse button pressed
00292             SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP                           mouse button released
00293         SDL_MOUSEWHEEL                          mouse wheel motion              Tablet or multiple mice input device events
00294         SDL_INPUTMOTION                         input moved
00295         SDL_INPUTBUTTONDOWN                             input button pressed
00296         SDL_INPUTBUTTONUP                               input button released
00297         SDL_INPUTWHEEL                          input wheel motion
00298         SDL_INPUTPROXIMITYIN                            input pen entered proximity
00299         SDL_INPUTPROXIMITYOUT                           input pen left proximity                Joystick events
00300          SDL_JOYAXISMOTION                              joystick axis motion
00301         SDL_JOYBALLMOTION                               joystick trackball motion
00302          SDL_JOYHATMOTION                               joystick hat position change
00303          SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN                              joystick button pressed
00304          SDL_JOYBUTTONUP                                joystick button released                Touch events
00305         SDL_FINGERDOWN
00306         SDL_FINGERUP
00307         SDL_FINGERMOTION
00308         SDL_TOUCHBUTTONDOWN
00309         SDL_TOUCHBUTTONUP                               Gesture events
00310         SDL_DOLLARGESTURE
00311         SDL_DOLLARRECORD
00312         SDL_MULTIGESTURE                                Clipboard events
00313         SDL_CLIPBOARDUPDATE                             the clipboard changed           Obsolete events
00314         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT1                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility
00315         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT2                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility
00316         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT3                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility                These are for your use, and should be allocated with
00317         SDL_RegisterEvents()
00318         SDL_USEREVENT                           a user-specified event
00319         SDL_LASTEVENT                           only for bounding internal arrays
00320         */
00321 
00322         while(SDL_PollEvent(&FromSDLRaw))
00323         {
00324             switch(FromSDLRaw.type)
00325             {
00326 
00327                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:     case SDL_KEYUP:             case SDL_JOYBUTTONUP:
00328                     _Data->RemoveMetaCodesToManualCheck( FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress);
00329                     break;
00330 
00331                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:   case SDL_KEYDOWN:           case SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN:
00332                     _Data->AddMetaCodesToManualCheck( FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress);
00333                     break;
00334 
00335                 case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:       case SDL_JOYAXISMOTION:     case SDL_JOYHATMOTION:      case SDL_JOYBALLMOTION: // What is a joyball, like the bowling games maybe, or the ORBit controller
00336                     FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw);
00337                     break;
00338 
00339                 case SDL_FIRSTEVENT:  //capture and ignore or throw error
00340                     World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unexpected 'FIRSTEVENT' event in event manager. User input seems corrupted.");
00341                     break;
00342 
00343                 case SDL_WINDOWEVENT:
00344                     this->AddEvent(new EventGameWindow(FromSDLRaw));
00345                     break;
00346 
00347                 case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00348                         // call a function with ifdefs here
00349                     break;
00350 
00351                 case SDL_QUIT:          //when SDL closes, but this really should be handled somewhere else, like the UpdateQuitEvents() function
00352                     World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unexpected Quit event in event manager.");
00353                     break;
00354 
00355                 default:                //Never thrown by SDL, but could be added by a user
00356                     //World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unknown SDL Event Inserted.");
00357                     World::GetWorldPointer()->Log("Unknown SDL Event Inserted. Likely an unhandled SDL 1.3 event");
00358                     break;
00359             }
00360         }
00361 
00362         // Here we iterate through manual check to insert any requested polling checks and perpetuate mousedown events
00363         for(internal::EventManagerInternalData::ManualCheckIterator Iter=_Data->ManualCheck.begin(); _Data->ManualCheck.end()!=Iter; ++Iter)
00364         {
00365             MetaCode::InputCode temp = (*Iter).first;
00366             bool found=false;
00367             for(EventUserInput::iterator LIter=FromSDLEvent->begin(); FromSDLEvent->end()!=LIter; ++LIter)
00368             {
00369                 if (Iter->first == LIter->GetCode())
00370                 {
00371                     found=true;
00372                     break;
00373                 }
00374             }
00375             if(!found)
00376             {
00377                 if(internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress & Iter->second)     //if the keypress event is in there, then the key must be down
00378                     { FromSDLEvent->AddCode(MetaCode::BUTTON_DOWN, Iter->first); }
00379                 else
00380                     { FromSDLEvent->AddCode(MetaCode::BUTTON_UP, Iter->first); }    //It must be just a polling check
00381             }
00382         }
00383 
00384         //Check to see if we should add a User input event or not. We wouldn't want to pass an empty event
00385         if(FromSDLEvent->GetMetaCodeCount()==0)
00386         {
00387             delete FromSDLEvent;
00388         }else{
00389             _Data->EventQ.push_back(FromSDLEvent);
00390         }
00391     }
00392 
00393     void EventManager::UpdateQuitEvents()
00394     {
00395 //        if (NULL == SDL_GetEventFilter())                       //Verify the Event filter is installed, if not, then install it.
00396         if(SDL_FALSE == SDL_GetEventFilter(0, 0))
00397         {
00398             SDL_SetEventFilter( internal::PhysSDLFilter, 0);
00399         }else{
00400             if(4==internal::PhysSDLFilter(0,0))                   //Pass it a null pointer to get it to "Not Callback Mode"
00401             {
00402                 this->AddEvent(new EventQuit());                //We need to make a quit event
00403             }else{
00404                 //all clear
00405             }
00406         }
00407     }
00408 
00409     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00410     // Filtered management functions - You choose YAYYYY!!!
00411     ///////////////////////////////////////
00412     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00413     {
00414         EventBase* results = 0;
00415         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00416         {
00417             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00418             {
00419                 results = (*Iter);
00420                 return results;
00421             }
00422         }
00423         return results;
00424     }
00425 
00426     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00427     {
00428         EventBase* results = 0;
00429         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00430         {
00431             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00432             {
00433                 results = (*Iter);
00434                 _Data->EventQ.erase(Iter);
00435                 return results;
00436             }
00437         }
00438         return results;
00439     }
00440 
00441     void EventManager::RemoveNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00442     {
00443         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00444         {
00445             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00446                 { _Data->EventQ.erase(Iter); }
00447         }
00448     }
00449 
00450     std::list<EventBase*>* EventManager::GetAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00451     {
00452         std::list<EventBase*>* TempList = new std::list<EventBase*>;
00453 
00454         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00455         {
00456             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00457             {
00458                 TempList->push_back(*Iter);
00459             }
00460         }
00461         return TempList;
00462     }
00463 
00464     void EventManager::RemoveAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00465     {
00466         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00467         {
00468             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00469             {
00470                 this->_Data->EventQ.remove(*Iter);
00471             }
00472         }
00473     }

00552     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00553     // Polling Functions
00554     ///////////////////////////////////////
00555     void EventManager::AddPollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToTryPolling)
00556     {
00557         if(InputToTryPolling.IsPollable())
00558         {
00559             this->_Data->AddInputCodeToManualCheck(InputToTryPolling.GetCode(), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Polling);
00560         }else{
00561             World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unsupported Polling Check on this Platform");
00562         }
00563     }
00564 
00565     void EventManager::RemovePollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToStopPolling)
00566     {
00567         this->_Data->RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(InputToStopPolling.GetCode(), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Polling);
00568     }
00569

00571     void EventManager::Initialize()
00572         {}
00573 
00574     void EventManager::DoMainLoopItems()
00575         { this->UpdateEvents(); }

00577     ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName EventManager::GetType() const
00578         { return ManagerBase::EventManager; }

00583 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00584 // Class External << Operators for streaming or assignment
00585 #ifdef PHYSXML
00586 std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& stream, const phys::EventManager& Mgr)
00587 {
00588     stream << "<EventManager Version=\"1\">";
00589     for(std::list<phys::EventBase*>::iterator Iter = Mgr._Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=Mgr._Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00590         { stream << **Iter; }
00591     for(phys::internal::EventManagerInternalData::ManualCheckIterator Iter=Mgr._Data->ManualCheck.begin(); Iter!=Mgr._Data->ManualCheck.end(); ++Iter)
00592         { stream << "<ManualCheck Version=\"1\" PollingType=\"" << Iter->second << "\" InputCode=\"" << Iter->first << "\" />"; }
00593     stream << "</EventManager>";
00594 
00595     return stream;
00596 }
00597 
00598 std::istream& PHYS_LIB operator >> (std::istream& stream, phys::EventManager& Mgr)
00599 {
00600     phys::String OneTag( phys::xml::GetOneTag(stream) );
00601     std::auto_ptr<phys::xml::Document> Doc( phys::xml::PreParseClassFromSingleTag("phys::", "EventManager", OneTag) );
00602 
00603     Doc->GetFirstChild() >> Mgr;
00604 
00605     return stream;
00606 }
00607 
00608 void operator >> (const phys::xml::Node& OneNode, phys::EventManager& Mgr)
00609 {
00610     if(phys::String(OneNode.Name()) == phys::String("EventManager"))
00611     {
00612         if (OneNode.GetAttribute("Version").AsInt() == 1)
00613         {
00614             phys::xml::Node Child = OneNode.GetFirstChild();
00615             while(Child)
00616             {
00617                 phys::String TagName(Child.Name());
00618                 if(TagName.length()>6)                  // I am pretty sure that the easiest wat to identify an event is by looking at the 6th
00619                 {                                       // Character and seeing what the actual name of the event is. So that is what this does.
00620                     switch(TagName[5])
00621                     {
00622                         case 'l':{
00623                             Mgr._Data->AddInputCodeToManualCheck(
00624                                 (Child.GetAttribute("InputCode").AsInt()),
00625                                 (Child.GetAttribute("PollingType").AsInt())
00626                             );}
00627                             break;
00628                         case 'C':{
00629                             phys::EventCollision *temp = new phys::EventCollision();
00630                             Child >> *temp;
00631                             Mgr.AddEvent(temp); }
00632                             break;
00633                         case 'G':{
00634                             phys::EventGameWindow *temp = new phys::EventGameWindow();
00635                             Child >> *temp;
00636                             Mgr.AddEvent(temp); }
00637                             break;
00638                         case 'Q':{
00639                             phys::EventQuit *temp = new phys::EventQuit();
00640                             Child >> *temp;
00641                             Mgr.AddEvent(temp); }
00642                             break;
00643                         case 'R':{
00644                             phys::EventRenderTime *temp = new phys::EventRenderTime();
00645                             Child >> *temp;
00646                             Mgr.AddEvent(temp); }
00647                             break;
00648                         case 'U':{
00649                             phys::EventUserInput *temp = new phys::EventUserInput();
00650                             Child >> *temp;
00651                             Mgr.AddEvent(temp); }
00652                             break;
00653                         case 'O':
00654                             throw phys::Exception ("Attemping to serialize a phys::Event::Other... not sure what you are trying to serialize.");
00655                             //throw Exception ("How did you instantiate an abstract base class?! Attemping to serialize a phys::EventBase");
00656                             break;
00657                         default:
00658                             throw phys::Exception ("Attemping to serialize a phys::Event... not sure what you are trying to serialize.");
00659                             break;
00660                     }
00661                 }else{
00662                     throw phys::Exception ("Invalid event, name is not long enough to identify event.");
00663                 } // end if name length
00664                 Child = Child.GetNextSibling();
00665             } // end while
00666         }else{
00667             throw( phys::Exception("Incompatible XML Version for EventManager: Not Version 1"));
00668         } // if version
00669     }else{
00670         throw( phys::Exception("Attempting to deserialize an EventManager, event mananger not found.") );
00671     }// if event
00672 }
00673 #endif // \PHYSXML
